pr_title: Fix the error on auth failure in the WebSocket

timeline.message:
Fix the issue

Remove the code duplication

Add error message

Remove constant duplication

timeline.author: daneshk

replies.bodyText: In the entity, the payload is set by the message_datasource key as native data. So, I use it to get the response's payload from the entity.
replies.author: kalaiyarasiganeshalingam

timeline.body: Shall we have a meaningful message instead of `e.getPrintableStackTrace()`, since it is there in the `e`

At some places,  colon comes in more than once places. I thought that it is not a good format. So, I have changed it to the bracket.

replies.author: kalaiyarasiganeshalingam

timeline.body: Throwing WebSocket exception during the HTTP flow seems incorrect. Still, the upgrade has not happed to WebSocket and this is a response flow to the HTTP request. 401 should go to the client without an exception thrown IMO
timeline.bodyText: Throwing WebSocket exception during the HTTP flow seems incorrect. Still, the upgrade has not happed to WebSocket and this is a response flow to the HTTP request. 401 should go to the client without an exception thrown IMO
timeline.bodyHTML: Throwing WebSocket exception during the HTTP flow seems incorrect. Still, the upgrade has not happed to WebSocket and this is a response flow to the HTTP request. 401 should go to the client without an exception thrown IMO
timeline.author: chamil321

replies.bodyText: According to the current implementation, Success and Errors are handled by OnUpgradeResourceCallback during the Websocket upgrade connection. So If we will throw the exception, OnError can handle that.
replies.author: kalaiyarasiganeshalingam

replies.bodyText:
Had a call with @kalaiyarasiganeshalingam and cleared the flow. (Ignore the above comment)
It seems like from the Auth filter an HTTP response(401) is sent to the WSClient instead of WebSocket response.
IMO at AuthFilter level, this should be handled not in the Respond method. If the Auth filter can identify the WebSocket upgrade request and respond appropriately then this exception will not have occurred.
@ldclakmal @daneshk WDYT?
replies.author: chamil321

replies.bodyText: In HTTP filter level, I don't think we have a way to identify whether this is an WS upgrade request. IMO, the transport pipeline should get updated to WS after authentication filters. Then we can simply respond (HTTP responses) with 401 or 403. Seems like, here the transport get updated before engaging filters. Shall we schedule a meeting and discuss this? WDYT?
replies.author: ldclakmal

replies.bodyText: +1 Let's have a meeting and discuss
replies.author: daneshk

timeline.body: We don't need this check here since this is checked at the library itself. We usually add this only if the message has any sting concatenation since that is heavy processing.
timeline.bodyText: We don't need this check here since this is checked at the library itself. We usually add this only if the message has any sting concatenation since that is heavy processing.

timeline.body: Is there a specific use case when `connectionObj.getNativeData(WebSocketConstants.WEBSOCKET_HANDSHAKER)` can be null?
timeline.bodyText: Is there a specific use case when connectionObj.getNativeData(WebSocketConstants.WEBSOCKET_HANDSHAKER) can be null?
timeline.bodyHTML: Is there a specific use case when connectionObj.getNativeData(WebSocketConstants.WEBSOCKET_HANDSHAKER) can be null?
timeline.author: niveathika

replies.bodyText: Yes. That is indicated this is not a request of the http Websocket upgrade.
replies.author: kalaiyarasiganeshalingam

timeline.bodyHTML:
We dont usually return Exceptions. Use throw. Also add a comment for the specific null check

Suggested change
if (connectionObj.getNativeData(WebSocketConstants.WEBSOCKET_HANDSHAKER) != null) {
throw getWebSocketException(outboundResponseObj);
} else {
return e;
}
if (connectionObj.getNativeData(WebSocketConstants.WEBSOCKET_HANDSHAKER) != null) {
throw getWebSocketException(outboundResponseObj);
}
throw e;
timeline.author: niveathika

replies.bodyText: These changes have been reverted in a30ea6f
